words.meaning: 牧放（牲畜、兽群）n. 兽群
在……后面 adv. 在后面；向后

words.example: She has a positive attitude toward challenges.

words.meaning: (C/U)声音；发音v硫听起来 adj. 无损的；健全的
完整的，完全的 vt. 完成，结束

words.example: She was nervous when she went onto the stage.

words.meaning: 当……时；像……(一样); 如同；因为，由于 prep. 作为；当作；
离开；走开; 断掉(电、水等); 完 prep. (表示脱离)
命令；指示. 订购；叫(菜、饮料等); 命令

words.example: It is logical to start with the easiest question.
He played an important role in the project.

words.meaning: 比赛；竞赛；对手；火柴t. 与……匹配
比赛；赛跑 n. (C)赛跑；种族
合用；分享 n. (C)一份；股票
肯定的；确信的；有把握的

words.example: Good leaders support their team members.
My shoes are too loose to run in.
A flock of birds flew over the lake.
May God bless you and your family.
Good health is a real blessing.

words.meaning: 行为；行动（尤指善行或恶行）
words.example: He was rewarded for his good deeds.
We must tackle the problem together.
The bird cleaned its feathers carefully.
The members are bound by friendship.
UN is an abbreviation for the United Nations.

phrases.example: Please make sure all the lights are off.

phrases.meaning: v. 花费时间/金钱做某事

phrases.example: She looks beautiful in that dress.
He looks angry but says nothing.
Take an umbrella in case it rains.
Your answer is as good as mine.
This phone is not as good as the old one.
Some students stayed behind to help the teacher.
Young people often flock together during holidays.

phrases.phrase: birds of the same feather flock together
phrases.example: They have similar interests—birds of the same feather flock together.
We can see mountains all around.
The team stayed together during difficult times.
They have been friends for so long.

phrases.meaning: 在舞台幕后；不在公众视野中
phrases.example: The singer is very quiet off stage.
We must pull together to solve the problem.
Please put the books in order.
She made notes while listening to the lecture.
I usually do a list before going shopping.
He complained to the manager about the service.

patterns.example: I hate to get up early in winter.

patterns.pattern: a is as adj. as b
patterns.example: This movie is as interesting as that one.

patterns.pattern: a is not as adj. as b
patterns.meaning: A不如B……（同级比较的否定形式）
patterns.example: This phone is not as expensive as that one.

patterns.meaning: 持续一段时间（表示动作或状态的持续）
patterns.example: He stayed in the city for a period of time.

grammar.title: 形容词/副词比较级
grammar.definition: 用于两者之间的比较，表示'更...'的意思。
grammar.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than / more + 形容词/副词原级 + than
usage: 单音节和部分双音节词：加-er（tall→taller, big→bigger）
多音节和部分双音节词：more + 原级（beautiful→more beautiful）
不规则变化：good/well→better, bad/badly→worse, many/much→more
比较级的修饰词：much, a lot, even, still, a little

mistakes.wrong: She is more taller than me.
mistakes.explanation: tall是单音节词，用-er形式，不需要more

mistakes.wrong: He runs more fast than me.
mistakes.explanation: fast的比较级是faster，不是more fast

mistakes.wrong: This book is more better.
mistakes.correct: This book is better / much better.
mistakes.explanation: good的比较级是better，不能用more修饰

examples: My sister is two years older than me.
This question is more difficult than that one.
He works much harder than before.

sub_topics.title: 比较级递增结构（more and more）
sub_topics.definition: 表示程度不断加深，意为“越来越……”。
sub_topics.structure: more and more + 形容词/副词
usage: 描述变化趋势
常用于抽象概念
examples: The weather is getting more and more cold.
English is becoming more and more important.

sub_topics.title: 比较级用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示两者之间的比较
sub_topics.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than
usage: 比较两个人或事物
强调程度变化
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammar.title: 构词法
grammar.definition: 构词法
grammar.structure: 形容词+名词构词法（proper → preparation）

sub_topics.title: 形容词+名词构词法（proper → preparation）
sub_topics.definition: 通过词缀将词性发生变化，常见为动词/形容词变名词
sub_topics.structure: 动词/形容词 + 名词后缀
usage: -tion, -ment 等常见后缀
词义相关但词性变化
examples: prepare → preparation
manage → management

sub_topics.title: 动词变名词（manage → management）
sub_topics.definition: 通过后缀将动词转化为名词
usage: 表示行为或过程
常用于抽象概念
examples: manage → management

sub_topics.title: 动词变名词/人（manage → manager）
sub_topics.definition: 表示“做某事的人”
usage: 表示职业或身份
examples: teach → teacher
manage → manager

sub_topics.title: 邀请类动词后接不定式
sub_topics.definition: 表示邀请、请求、建议他人去做某事
sub_topics.structure: invite / ask + sb. + to do sth.
usage: 不能接 doing
强调将来动作
examples: She invited me to join the party.

grammar.title: say/tell/speak/talk辨析
grammar.definition: 四个表示'说'的动词用法不同：say强调说的内容，tell强调告诉某人，speak强调说某种语言，talk强调交谈。
grammar.structure: say sth. / tell sb. sth. / tell sb. to do sth. / speak + 语言 / talk to/with sb. about sth.
usage: say：强调说的内容，say sth., say to sb.
tell：告诉某人，tell sb. sth., tell sb. to do sth., tell a story/lie/joke
speak：说某种语言，演讲，speak English, speak to sb.
talk：交谈，talk to/with sb., talk about sth.

mistakes.wrong: He said me the news.
mistakes.explanation: tell后可直接接双宾语，say不可以

mistakes.wrong: Can you tell English?
mistakes.explanation: 说某种语言用speak

mistakes.wrong: I want to say with you.
mistakes.correct: I want to talk with you.
mistakes.explanation: 与某人交谈用talk with

examples: He said nothing about it.
Please tell me your name.
She can speak three languages.
They are talking about the movie.

sub_topics.title: tell的固定用法（tell sb. to do sth.）
sub_topics.definition: tell表示命令或告知去做某事
usage: 不能用doing
examples: The teacher told us to be quiet.

sub_topics.title: say、speak、talk、tell的区别
sub_topics.definition: 四个动词在用法和侧重点上不同
usage: 注意固定搭配
examples: She speaks English.
He told me the truth.

sub_topics.title: tell与talk的用法区别
sub_topics.definition: tell强调告诉内容，talk强调交谈
sub_topics.structure: tell sb. sth.; talk to/with sb.
usage: tell后直接接内容
talk常与介词搭配
examples: She told me the truth.
He talked to his teacher.

sub_topics.title: tell/talk/speak/say的区别
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: talk的固定搭配用法
sub_topics.definition: talk常与不同介词搭配，意义不同
sub_topics.structure: talk about / talk to / talk with
usage: talk about 表示谈论内容
talk to/with 表示与某人交谈
examples: We talked about the problem.
She talked to her teacher.

grammar.title: 可数名词语不可数名词
keywords: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.definition: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.structure: 可数名词与不可数名词

sub_topics.title: 可数名词与不可数名词
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

grammar.title: 过去分词 (v. -ed作形容词)
grammar.definition: 由动词过去分词形式构成，可以作定语、状语、表语和宾语补足语，表示被动或完成。
grammar.structure: 动词过去分词 (规则动词加-ed，不规则动词需记忆)
usage: 作定语（表被动/完成）：the broken window = the window which was broken
作表语：I am interested in English.
作宾语补足语：I found the door locked.
作状语：Seen from the top, the city looks beautiful.

mistakes.wrong: I am very interesting in music.
mistakes.correct: I am very interested in music.
mistakes.explanation: 人作主语时用-ed形式表示感受

mistakes.wrong: I am boring.
mistakes.explanation: bored表示'感到无聊的'，boring表示'令人无聊的'

examples: The excited children opened their presents.
I feel tired after the long walk.
Written in English, the book is hard to understand.

sub_topics.title: 过去分词的三种用法
sub_topics.definition: 过去分词的主要功能
sub_topics.structure: 完成时；被动语态；形容词
usage: have done
be done
修饰名词
examples: The broken window was fixed.

grammar.title: some和any的用法
grammar.definition: some多用于肯定句，any多用于否定句和疑问句。
grammar.structure: some / any + 名词
usage: 数量不确定时使用
examples: I have some books.
I don't have any money.

grammar.title: 代词 (人称/物主/反身/指示)
grammar.definition: 用来代替名词或名词短语的词，包括人称代词、物主代词、反身代词、指示代词等。
grammar.structure: 根据在句中的成分选择相应形式
usage: 人称代词主格（作主语）：I, you, he, she, it, we, they
人称代词宾格（作宾语）：me, you, him, her, it, us, them
形容词性物主代词（后接名词）：my, your, his, her, its, our, their
名词性物主代词（独立使用）：mine, yours, his, hers, its, ours, theirs
反身代词：myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, themselves

mistakes.wrong: Me and Tom are friends.
mistakes.explanation: 作主语用主格I，且把自己放后面

mistakes.wrong: This is her, not my.
mistakes.explanation: 独立使用时用名词性物主代词

mistakes.wrong: He hurt hisself.
mistakes.explanation: 反身代词是himself，不是hisself

examples: She gave me a book.
This is my book. That is yours.
He taught himself English.

sub_topics.title: pronoun
sub_topics.definition: 代词，用来代替名词或名词短语，避免重复，使句子更简洁

grammar.title: 被动语态
grammar.definition: 当主语是动作的承受者时，使用被动语态。强调动作的承受者或动作本身。
grammar.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词 + (by + 动作执行者)
usage: 不知道或不必说明动作执行者：The window was broken.
强调动作承受者：The book was written by Lu Xun.
客观报道或正式场合：The meeting will be held tomorrow.
各种时态的被动：is done, was done, will be done, has been done等

mistakes.wrong: The car was repair yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: be后面要用动词的过去分词

mistakes.wrong: The book is belonged to me.
mistakes.explanation: belong是不及物动词，没有被动语态

examples: English is spoken all over the world.
The bridge was built in 1990.
The work must be finished on time.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 强调动作承受者
usage: 不知道或不强调动作执行者
examples: The room is cleaned every day.

sub_topics.title: be + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成被动语态。
usage: 强调承受动作
examples: The door is closed.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态结构
sub_topics.definition: 强调动作承受者
usage: 不知道或不强调执行者
examples: The house is built.

sub_topics.title: will + be + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 被动语态结构（be + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示主语是动作的承受者
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词 (+ by...)
usage: 不知道或不强调动作执行者
强调结果
examples: The window is broken.

sub_topics.title: 被动语态的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示动作的承受者是主语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + be + 过去分词
usage: 强调动作的承受者
不知道或不强调动作执行者
examples: The window is broken.

grammar.title: 感官动词
grammar.definition: 感官动词
grammar.structure: 感官动词后接do / doing的区别

sub_topics.title: 感官动词后接do / doing的区别

grammar.title: 定语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中修饰名词或代词的从句，通常紧跟在被修饰的词（先行词）之后。
grammar.structure: 先行词 + 关系词(who/which/that/whose/where/when) + 从句
usage: who/that指人：The man who/that is talking is my father.
which/that指物：The book which/that I bought is interesting.
whose表所属：The girl whose mother is a doctor is my friend.
where指地点：This is the school where I studied.
when指时间：I still remember the day when I met you.

mistakes.wrong: The man which is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.correct: The man who/that is talking is my teacher.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是人时，用who或that，不用which

mistakes.wrong: The book who I bought is good.
mistakes.correct: The book which/that I bought is good.
mistakes.explanation: 先行词是物时，用which或that，不用who

mistakes.wrong: This is the place where I visited.
mistakes.correct: This is the place which/that I visited.
mistakes.explanation: visit是及物动词，需要宾语，用which/that而非where

examples: I have a friend who can speak five languages.
The movie that we saw last night was exciting.
I'll never forget the day when I graduated.

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（that引导）
sub_topics.definition: that引导从句修饰名词
usage: that作主语或宾语
examples: The book that I like is interesting.

sub_topics.title: 名词 + 定语从句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 定语从句（后置定语）
sub_topics.definition: 修饰名词的从句，通常放在名词后
sub_topics.structure: 名词 + 关系词 + 从句
usage: that / who / which 等
examples: The boy who is reading is my brother.

grammar.title: 定语
grammar.definition: 定语
grammar.structure: 后置定语

sub_topics.title: 后置定语
sub_topics.definition: 修饰名词且放在名词之后
usage: 多用于复杂修饰
examples: the students in the room
the book that I bought

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在造成的影响或结果，也表示从过去持续到现在的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去的动作对现在的影响：I have lost my key. (现在没有钥匙)
表示经历：Have you ever been to Beijing?
表示持续到现在的状态：I have lived here for 10 years.
常与already, yet, just, ever, never, for, since连用

mistakes.wrong: I have see the movie.
mistakes.explanation: have/has后面要用动词的过去分词形式

mistakes.wrong: I have bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: 有具体过去时间（yesterday），不能用现在完成时

mistakes.wrong: He has gone to Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.correct: He has been in Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.explanation: have gone表示去了还没回来，不能与for连用

examples: She has already finished her homework.
I have never met him before.
We have known each other since 2020.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并对现在有影响
usage: 强调结果或经验
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: have/has + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 构成现在完成时。
usage: 表示完成或经验
examples: I have finished my homework.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并影响现在的动作
usage: 经验
结果
持续
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: have + 过去分词
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构（have/has + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 强调结果或经历
常与 already, ever 连用
examples: I have finished my work.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在产生影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示已完成的动作
表示经验或结果
examples: I have finished my work.

grammar.title: 一般过去时
grammar.definition: 表示过去某一时间发生的动作或存在的状态，也表示过去经常或反复发生的动作。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 动词过去式（be动词用was/were）
usage: 表示过去发生的动作：I visited my grandma yesterday.
表示过去存在的状态：He was a teacher ten years ago.
表示过去的习惯：When I was young, I often played football.

mistakes.wrong: I go to Beijing last year.
mistakes.correct: I went to Beijing last year.
mistakes.explanation: 有过去时间标志词（last year），动词要用过去式

mistakes.wrong: Did you went there?
mistakes.explanation: did后面的动词要用原形

examples: She bought a new dress yesterday.
They were happy at the party.
I didn't watch TV last night.

sub_topics.title: 一般过去时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作
usage: 与过去时间状语连用
examples: I went to school yesterday.

grammar.title: 常用介词
grammar.definition: 用在名词、代词或动名词前，表示时间、地点、方式、原因等关系的词。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词/代词/动名词
usage: 时间：at+时刻, on+具体日期, in+年月季节长时段
地点：at+小地点, in+大地点/里面, on+表面
方式：by+交通工具/方式, with+工具/材料, in+语言/颜色
常见搭配：be good at, be interested in, look for, wait for, listen to

mistakes.wrong: I arrived at Beijing.
mistakes.explanation: arrive in+大地点，arrive at+小地点

mistakes.wrong: I go to school by a bus.
mistakes.correct: I go to school by bus.
mistakes.explanation: by+交通工具中间不加冠词

mistakes.wrong: I'm looking forward to see you.
mistakes.correct: I'm looking forward to seeing you.
mistakes.explanation: look forward to后面接动名词

examples: The meeting will be held at 3 o'clock on Monday.
She goes to work by subway.
He is good at playing basketball.

sub_topics.title: 介词to和for的用法区别
sub_topics.definition: to强调动作结果指向，for强调受益对象
sub_topics.structure: be important to sb.; be good for sb.
usage: to表示方向或结果
for表示受益或用途
examples: This book is important to me.
Exercise is good for your health.

sub_topics.title: 介词后只能接名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形
usage: to do中的to不是介词
examples: without water
without eating

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法（后接名词或动名词）
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法
sub_topics.definition: without表示“没有”，后接名词或doing。
usage: 表示缺少某物或行为
examples: He left without saying goodbye.
She passed the exam without effort.

sub_topics.title: 介词to的用法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

grammar.title: 动词
grammar.definition: 动词
grammar.structure: 动词

grammar.title: 可数名词复数变化规则
keywords: 可数名词复数变化规则
grammar.definition: 表示数量大于一的可数名词需要使用复数形式
grammar.structure: 名词 + s / es 或不规则变化
usage: 一般情况直接加s
以s, x, sh, ch结尾加es
以辅音字母+y结尾，变y为i再加es
少数名词为不规则变化
examples: books
boxes
cities
men

grammar.title: spend/take/cost/pay辨析
grammar.definition: 四个表示'花费'的词用法不同：spend主语是人，take常用It作主语，cost主语是物，pay主语是人且用于付款。
grammar.structure: sb. spend time/money (in) doing / on sth. | It takes sb. time to do sth. | sth. cost sb. money | sb. pay money for sth.
usage: spend：人作主语，spend time/money (in) doing sth. / on sth.
take：It作形式主语，It takes sb. time to do sth.
cost：物作主语，sth. cost sb. money
pay：人作主语，sb. pay money for sth.

mistakes.wrong: I spent two hours to finish it.
mistakes.correct: I spent two hours finishing it.
mistakes.explanation: spend time doing sth.，不用to do

mistakes.wrong: The book takes me 50 yuan.
mistakes.explanation: 花钱买东西用cost，take用于花时间

mistakes.wrong: I costed 100 yuan for the book.
mistakes.correct: I paid 100 yuan for the book.
mistakes.explanation: 人作主语花钱用pay

examples: I spent an hour doing my homework.
It took me two hours to finish the work.
This dress cost me 200 yuan.
I paid 50 dollars for this shirt.

grammar.title: help sb. do sth.
grammar.definition: 表示“帮助某人做某事”，强调在他人完成某个动作或任务过程中给予帮助。
grammar.structure: help sb. do sth.
usage: help 后接宾语 sb.，再接动词原形
动词 do 为省略 to 的不定式
在口语和书面语中都非常常见
被动语态中需补出 to：sb. be helped to do sth.
examples: She helped me finish the homework.
Can you help him carry the box?
I was helped to solve the problem by my teacher.

grammar.title: 不可数名词加s后的意义变化
grammar.definition: 部分不可数名词在加-s后，意义会发生变化，不再表示原本的抽象或物质概念，而是引申出新的含义。
grammar.structure: 不可数名词 + s
usage: 表示类别或范围扩大，如water → waters（水域）
表示不同方面或具体实例，如time → times（次数、时代）
examples: The waters of the Yellow Sea are very deep.
I have visited Beijing many times.

grammar.title: 介词at和in的用法
grammar.definition: at和in都表示地点或时间，但使用范围和侧重点不同。
grammar.structure: at + 小地点/具体时刻；in + 大地点/较长时间
usage: at用于具体位置或时刻，如at the door, at 7 o’clock
in用于较大空间或时间段，如in the room, in 2025
examples: She arrived at the station at noon.
He lives in Shanghai.

grammar.title: 现在完成进行时
grammar.definition: 表示动作从过去开始，一直持续到现在，并且现在仍在进行或刚结束。
grammar.structure: have has been doing
usage: 强调动作的持续性
常与for, since等时间状语连用
examples: I have been studying English for five years.
She has been working all morning.

grammar.title: 同级比较as. .. as结构
grammar.definition: 用于比较两者在某方面程度相同。
grammar.structure: as adj. as
usage: 第一个as是副词，第二个as是连词
中间必须用形容词或副词原级
examples: This task is as difficult as the last one.
He runs as fast as his brother.

grammar.title: 系动词用法
grammar.definition: 系动词用于连接主语和表语，说明主语的状态、性质或特征。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 系动词 + 表语（形容词/名词等）
usage: 常见系动词有be, look, sound, feel, become, stay
系动词后不能直接接宾语
examples: She looks happy.
The soup smells good.

grammar.title: for加时间段的用法
grammar.definition: for用于表示动作或状态持续的时间长度。
grammar.structure: for + 时间段
usage: 常与完成时或一般过去时连用
回答how long提问
examples: They have lived here for ten years.
He waited for two hours.

grammar.title: as的多种用法
grammar.definition: as是多功能词，可作介词、连词或副词，含义依语境而变。
grammar.structure: as + 名词；as + 从句；as adj. as
usage: 表示“作为”，如as a teacher
表示“因为/当……时”，引导原因或时间状语从句
用于同级比较结构
examples: As a student, you should study hard.
As it was raining, we stayed inside.

grammar.title: 副词修饰动词
grammar.definition: 副词用于修饰动词，说明动作的方式、程度、频率等。
grammar.structure: 动词 + 副词 或 副词 + 动词
usage: 常见副词以-ly结尾，如quickly, carefully
副词一般不修饰名词
examples: She speaks clearly.
He quickly finished the work.

grammar.title: 缩写词的构成与理解
grammar.definition: 缩写词是由一个词组或专有名词中的首字母或部分字母组成的简略形式，用来提高表达效率，在阅读理解和科技、新闻语境中非常常见。
grammar.structure: 首字母缩写 或 单词部分缩写
usage: 首字母缩写通常每个字母代表一个单词，如UN（United Nations）
有些缩写需要全部大写，如VIP, WHO, PRC
有些缩写可以作为普通名词使用，如TV, exam
理解缩写时应结合上下文和完整形式推断含义
examples: UN stands for the United Nations.
VIP means very important person.
DIY means do it yourself.
WHO is the World Health Organization.

grammar.title: 过去式，过去分词
grammar.definition: 举办；持有 (过去式，过去分词)

grammar.title: 用于比较级前加强语气
grammar.definition: 更加；多得多（用于比较级前加强语气）
